page.title: 01THE CHEW VALLEY
page.content: The flooding of this valley by damming the River Chew and its tributaries has now been accepted by the local inhabitants. The original objections on the loss of rich farmland have now given way to an appreciation of the new beauty of the area. Birds flock in their thousands to the lake either to over winter or rest on their journey to other breeding grounds. Work on the land is very important to the communities but on the whole the villages and hamlets are now mainly dormitories used by the commuters who work in the cities of Bath, Bristol and Wells.The communities are very lively and clubs and organisations exist for children and adults alike. A variety of different types of house can be found from old cottages to modern houses.
